newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * Romania expects the U.S.-Russia summit in Helsinki to set the principles stated by all NATO members, namely integration of new democracies into the Alliance, elimination of old tensions and the establishment of a climate allowing economic revival and conflict prevention, foreign ministry spokeswoman Gilda Lazar told a news conference.
* Russia will stick to its opposition to NATO's eastward expansion, irrespective of the result of the Helsinki summit, a Kremlin spokesman said on Wednesday.
* Romanian and Russian diplomats will hold talks in Moscow on March 28, seeking to boost economic cooperation, Lazar said.
* Parliament's standing commission started debates on the 1997 draft budget.

* Turkey will back Romania to get an invitation to become a NATO member later this year, Turkish Deputy Chief of Staff, General Cevik Bir, said at the end of an visit to Romania, during which he met Defence Minister Victor Babiuc and Romanian Army Chief of Staff, General Constantin Degeratu.
* Foreign Minister Adrian Severin will attend a Brussels meeting of European Union foreign ministers with their counterparts from Central and Eastern Europe, Lazar said.
She said Severin will make two-day visit to Portugal starting March 26.

* The opposition Party of Social Democracy (PDSR) wrote an open letter to President Emil Constantinescu to ask for a meeting of political party leaders with the president over recent positions taken in parliament by the ruling coalition.

The PDSR slammed the ruling coalition for allegedly breaching the constitution and establishing a "majority disctatorship" in parliament. The letter, signed by PDSR leader Ion Iliescu, says the party will not boycott debates on the 1997 budget and the government reform package. -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
